block.p: Christina Drayton Corbett, the daughter of Victoria P. Boyd and Andrew J. Corbett Jr., both of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Andrew McGinness, a son of Lucille McGinness and Robert E. McGinness of Wellesley, Mass. Frances A. Richards, a justice of the peace, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's maternal grandfather, Christopher H. Phillips, in Ipswich, Mass.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 29, graduated from Trinity College in Hartford.

Christina Drayton Corbett, the daughter of Victoria P. Boyd and Andrew J. Corbett Jr., both of New York, was married yesterday to Robert Andrew McGinness, a son of Lucille McGinness and Robert E. McGinness of Wellesley, Mass. Frances A. Richards, a justice of the peace, performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's maternal grandfather, Christopher H. Phillips, in Ipswich, Mass.
The bride and the bridegroom, both 29, graduated from Trinity College in Hartford.

Mrs. McGinness is a substitute teacher at the Montessori school in Andover, Mass. Her father is the president of A. J. Corbett & Sons, a shipping company in New York. Her mother is an interior designer in New York.

The bride's stepfather, William Y. Boyd II, is the chairman of the Boyd Steamship Corporation, Panama Canal agents. Her grandfather Mr. Phillips was the deputy permanent representative of the United States to the United Nations from 1969 to 1973 and the ambassador to Brunei during the Bush Administration.

Mr. McGinness is a senior technical support engineer at EDocs, a company in Natick, Mass., that provides online billing and customer management services. His father, who is retired, worked in Wellesley as the chief compliance officer and general counsel for United States operations of SunLife Financial.
